documentType: Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Report
summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services report assessing Jeffrey Epstein's competency to proceed with a disciplinary process following an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation. The report, dated July 30, 2019, concludes Epstein was competent, references a prior suicide risk assessment, and notes uncertainty about how marks on his neck were obtained.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being evaluated for competency to proceed with a disciplinary process after being charged with code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) under incident report number 3282555.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Tattooing/Self-Mutilation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with Bureau of Prisons code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation), assigned incident report number 3282555.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: A Suicide Risk Assessment was conducted on Epstein where he denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.

events.title: Follow-up Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: A follow-up Suicide Risk Assessment noted it was unclear if Epstein placed a string around his own neck or if someone else did.

events.title: Competency Evaluation Completed
events.description: A psychology services provider completed an evaluation determining Jeffrey Epstein was COMPETENT to proceed with the disciplinary process.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was charged with a BOP code violation for 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' (incident report 3282555).
A psychological evaluation on July 30, 2019, found Epstein competent to proceed with the disciplinary process related to this charge.
A Suicide Risk Assessment from July 23, 2019, stated it was 'unclear' if Epstein had placed a string around his own neck or if someone else had done it.
Epstein consistently denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior in assessments dated July 9 and July 23, 2019.
